text:
Harry Potter author J.K. Rowling has been accused of appropriating the “living tradition of a marginalised people” by writing about the Navajo legend of the skinwalker in a new story.

Ms. Rowling posted the first part of a four-part series, the “History of Magic in North America” on her website Pottermore, on March 8, depicting the magical history of America within her fictional universe of witches and wizards.

The series of stories, titled A History of Magic in North America , will give fans the historical background to the latest Harry Potter film, Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them , ahead of its November release, reported The Guardian .

But it has upset a number of Native American writers and activists, who have objected to the new material’s depiction of their spiritual beliefs. — PTI
title: New Potter stories enrage native Americans
